name: EU General Data Protection Regulation
description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy for all individuals within the European Union and the European Economic Area. It addresses the transfer of personal data outside the EU and EEA areas and aims to give individuals control over their personal data and to simplify the regulatory environment for international business.

domains.name: Principles
domains.description: Core principles relating to the processing of personal data, including lawfulness, fairness, transparency, purpose limitation, data minimisation, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity, confidentiality, and accountability.

controls.title: Lawfulness, Fairness and Transparency
controls.description: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject. Processing must have a valid legal basis and data subjects must be informed about how their data is being used.
typical_evidence: Privacy notices and data processing disclosures
Lawful basis assessments for each processing activity

controls.title: Purpose Limitation
controls.description: Personal data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes. Further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes, or statistical purposes shall not be considered incompatible.
typical_evidence: Purpose compatibility assessments for secondary uses

controls.title: Data Minimisation
controls.description: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed.
typical_evidence: System configuration showing minimal data collection

controls.title: Accuracy
controls.description: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date. Every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay.

controls.title: Storage Limitation
controls.description: Personal data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed. Appropriate technical and organizational measures must be implemented to safeguard data subject rights.

controls.title: Integrity and Confidentiality
controls.description: Personal data shall be processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures.
typical_evidence: Security incident reports and response records

controls.title: Accountability
controls.description: The controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with, the data protection principles. Organizations must maintain documentation and evidence of their compliance efforts.
typical_evidence: Internal audit reports on data protection
Board-level reporting on data protection compliance

domains.name: Rights of Data Subjects
domains.description: The rights afforded to individuals regarding their personal data, including the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability, and the right to object to processing.

controls.title: Transparent Information and Communication
controls.description: The controller shall take appropriate measures to provide any information relating to processing to the data subject in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.

controls.title: Right of Access
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning them are being processed, and where that is the case, access to the personal data and specific information about the processing.
typical_evidence: SAR tracking log with response times

controls.title: Right to Rectification
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning them. The data subject shall have the right to have incomplete personal data completed.

controls.title: Right to Erasure (Right to Be Forgotten)
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning them without undue delay where specified grounds apply, including when data is no longer necessary, consent is withdrawn, or data has been unlawfully processed.
typical_evidence: Technical capability to delete data across systems

controls.title: Right to Restriction of Processing
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller restriction of processing where certain conditions apply, such as contesting accuracy, unlawful processing, or the controller no longer needing the data.

controls.title: Right to Data Portability
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right to receive the personal data concerning them, which they have provided to a controller, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller.
typical_evidence: Technical capability for automated data export

controls.title: Right to Object
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to their particular situation, at any time to processing of personal data concerning them which is based on legitimate interests or the performance of a task carried out in the public interest.

controls.title: Automated Individual Decision-Making and Profiling
controls.description: The data subject shall have the right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing, including profiling, which produces legal effects concerning them or similarly significantly affects them, except in specific circumstances.
typical_evidence: Human review procedures for automated decisions

domains.name: Controller and Processor
domains.description: Obligations for data controllers and processors, including responsibility, data protection by design and by default, records of processing, security of processing, data breach notification, and data protection impact assessments.

controls.title: Responsibility of the Controller
controls.description: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure and to be able to demonstrate that processing is performed in accordance with the GDPR, taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risks to the rights and freedoms of natural persons.

controls.title: Data Protection by Design and by Default
controls.description: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures designed to implement data-protection principles effectively and integrate necessary safeguards into processing. By default, only personal data which are necessary for each specific purpose shall be processed.
typical_evidence: Privacy by design checklists and procedures

controls.title: Processor Requirements
controls.description: Where processing is to be carried out on behalf of a controller, the controller shall use only processors providing sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in such a manner that processing will meet the requirements of the GDPR.

controls.title: Records of Processing Activities
controls.description: Each controller and, where applicable, the controller's representative, shall maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility, including purposes, categories of data subjects, categories of personal data, recipients, transfers, retention periods, and security measures.
typical_evidence: Processing activity review and update records

controls.title: Security of Processing
controls.description: The controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including pseudonymisation and encryption, ability to ensure ongoing confidentiality, ability to restore availability, and a process for regularly testing security measures.
typical_evidence: Security testing and penetration test reports
Business continuity and disaster recovery plans

controls.title: Notification of a Personal Data Breach to the Supervisory Authority
controls.description: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it, notify the personal data breach to the supervisory authority, unless the breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons.
typical_evidence: Data breach response plan and procedures

controls.title: Data Protection Impact Assessment
controls.description: Where a type of processing, in particular using new technologies, is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall, prior to the processing, carry out an assessment of the impact of the envisaged processing operations on the protection of personal data.

domains.name: Remedies and Penalties
domains.description: Provisions related to the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, the right to an effective judicial remedy, the right to compensation, and the conditions for imposing administrative fines.

controls.title: Right to Lodge a Complaint with a Supervisory Authority
controls.description: Every data subject shall have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority if they consider that the processing of personal data relating to them infringes the GDPR. The organization must have procedures to handle and respond to regulatory complaints.
typical_evidence: Information on how to complain in privacy notices

controls.title: Right to Compensation and Liability
controls.description: Any person who has suffered material or non-material damage as a result of an infringement of the GDPR shall have the right to receive compensation from the controller or processor for the damage suffered. Organizations must maintain appropriate insurance and liability management.
typical_evidence: Liability and indemnification clauses in contracts
Liability allocation between controllers and processors

controls.title: General Conditions for Imposing Administrative Fines
controls.description: Each supervisory authority shall ensure that the imposition of administrative fines shall be effective, proportionate and dissuasive. Organizations must understand and prepare for the conditions and factors that affect the level of fines for non-compliance.
typical_evidence: Remediation tracking for identified compliance gaps
Evidence of cooperation with supervisory authorities
